glsa.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Opera, allowing for execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.

description.p: Michal Zalewski reported two vulnerabilities, memory corruption when adding news feed sources from a website (CVE-2008-1761) as well as when processing HTML CANVAS elements to use scaled images (CVE-2008-1762). Additionally, an unspecified weakness related to keyboard handling of password inputs has been reported (CVE-2008-1764).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to visit a specially crafted web site or news feed and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Opera.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
